result.execSummary:
The defendant Janis C Kallin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid in 60 days or penalty of 7 days jail for non-payment.  Defendant may also perform community service in lieu of payment of fine at the rate of $10.00 per hour.  Court must receive proof of completion prior to due date.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Janis C Kallin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Janis C Kallin in court with Attorney Justin Singleton.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for plea and sentencing.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Singleton makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defandant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  FINE: $357.50 - to be paid in 60 days, alternate 7 days jail if not paid.   In lieu of payment of fine, Defendant may perform community service at rate of $10.00 per hour within 60 days

Defendant Janis C Kallin in court with Attorney Kirk Redetzke for Attorney Justin Singleton.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Redetzke requests a plea and sentence date.    Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact Walmart Store listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Janis C Kallin in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
